Class Tile.OccupiedTile

java.lang.Object
engine.forBoard.Tile
engine.forBoard.Tile.OccupiedTile
Enclosing class:
Tile
public static final class Tile.OccupiedTile extends Tile
The OccupiedTile class represents a tile on a chess board that contains a piece. It is a subclass of the abstract Tile class that represents tiles occupied by chess pieces.

This class provides implementations for the abstract methods defined in the Tile class, always indicating that the tile is occupied and returning the associated piece.

Author:
Aaron Ho

  • Field Details

    • pieceOnTile

      private final Piece pieceOnTile
      The chess piece positioned on this tile. This field stores the reference to the piece that occupies the tile.

  • Constructor Details

    • OccupiedTile

      private OccupiedTile(int tileCoordinate, Piece pieceOnTile)
      Constructs an occupied tile at the specified coordinate with the given piece. This constructor is private to enforce the use of the Tile factory method.
      Parameters:
      tileCoordinate - The coordinate of the tile on the board (0-63).
      pieceOnTile - The piece that occupies this tile.

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of the occupied tile, which is the string representation of the piece on this tile. White pieces are displayed in uppercase, while black pieces are displayed in lowercase.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      A string representing the piece on this tile.

    • isTileOccupied

      public boolean isTileOccupied()
      Indicates that this tile is occupied by a piece.
      Specified by:
      isTileOccupied in class Tile
      Returns:
      true, as an occupied tile always has a piece.

    • getPiece

      public Piece getPiece()
      Returns the piece on this tile.
      Specified by:
      getPiece in class Tile
      Returns:
      The piece that occupies this tile.
